main event: A bright, unidentified object was observed over Washington, D.C. for approximately 30-45 seconds in July 1964.
interesting points: The object was described as brighter than the planet Venus, with a transparent or globe-like appearance and one or two bright highlights.
The object exhibited a smooth, satellite-like motion and was estimated to be about 5 miles away.
The witness, an amateur astronomer and electronics engineer, reported the sighting to NASA and Georgetown University astronomers, who indicated they had not received any similar reports.
The object could not be identified as any known aircraft or military vehicle, and its flight characteristics, including constant speed and erratic maneuvers, were unusual.
Several other people, including children, also reportedly witnessed the object.
sighted object: a bright, unidentified object with a transparent or globe-like appearance
witnesses: an amateur astronomer and electronics engineer, along with several other people including children
